intro: Geniosporum helenae, commonly known as Helen's ghostflower, is a rare and delicate plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has a short growing season and is often found in areas with high humidity and cool temperatures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
